content.question: <math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math><math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math><math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math><math alttext="5"><mn>5</mn></math><math alttext="7"><mn>7</mn></math><math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math><math alttext="negative 36"><mo>-</mo><mn>36</mn></math><math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math><math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math><math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math><math alttext="12"><mn>12</mn></math> ​Values of the polynomial function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> for selected values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> are given in the table. If all of the zeros of the function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> are given in the table, which of the following must be true?

choices.label: ​The function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> has a local minimum at <math alttext="open parentheses negative 1 comma negative 36 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>36</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>.

​The function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> has a local minimum at <math alttext="open parentheses 5 comma 0 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>.

​The function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> has a local maximum at <math alttext="open parentheses 3 comma 4 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>.

​The function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> has a local maximum at <math alttext="open parentheses 1 comma 0 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>.

content.answer: ​The function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> has a local minimum at <math alttext="open parentheses 5 comma 0 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>.

topic.text: 1.4: Polynomial Functions and Rates of Change

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
